metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4014 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The capabilities implementation in the Linux kernel before 3.14.8 does notproperly consider that namespaces are inapplicable to inodes, which allowslocal users to bypass intended chmod restrictions by first creating a usernamespace, as demonstrated by setting the setgid bit on a file with groupownership of root.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4014` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.2.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.2.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required
